text: thus far most if not all of Brazil's
stadiums new and refurbished including
the Moroccan are here in Rio have stood
up pretty well to the demands and rigors
of World Cup football but all along
there have been concerns about the
safety and the integrity of temporary
structures now this video circulating
online taken at the opening game here
between Argentina and Bosnia highlights
some of those worries the footage shot
from the top of the stairs shows the
entire structure the scaffolding
wobbling from side to side as thousands
of fans walk up the steps towards the
Moroccan our stadium well this might
these are the obvious concerns has been
no attempt to close the staircase down
ahead of the next game here at the
Moroccan are when yet again thousands of
fans will come up these steps it all
does seem to have been put together in
something of a hurry but when asked
about the video the local organizers
said it was a responsibility of the
local government they in turn say it's
an issue for the state
but all in all things have gone pretty
well a few fans try to climb into the
steady meal without tickets but FIFA can
be delighted with the way that things
have gone so far the issue of temporary
structures who pays for them and when
they're built has been one of the
biggest issues between local organizers
and FIFA we're nearly a week into the
World Cup now and FIFA pretty delighted
with the way things have gone but this
kind of thing does not inspire
confidence
